common_issues.title: Pieces OS LTM High CPU Usage
common_issues.description: Users report high CPU usage and system slowdowns, particularly with apps like Slack, Discord, and Edge, linked to the Long Term Memory (LTM) feature in Pieces OS.  Workarounds include disabling LTM, switching processing mode to Cloud, or moving Pieces folders to a different drive. The Pieces team is actively investigating and releasing updates to address these performance issues.

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
related_issues.text:
Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Turning on Long Term Memory has been slowing down my desktop computer, even before LTM-2. After updating today, it still happens. It's most noticeable when I use Slack and Discord, and disabling those apps on LTM doesn't work. Even after switching the Processing Mode to Cloud, as suggested by HRA42 on the Discord server, the lag still occurs. At some point, the total CPU usage went up by over 90%.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eaef0d65-b19b-41f0-bf8a-f143fa8d1e43)

My computer specs:
- CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i3-6300 CPU @ 3.80GHz
- RAM: DDR4 32 GB
- Graphics: GeForce GTX 950 2 GB

I'm yet to notice significant slowness on other programs, but if I'm getting a lot of lag on those chat apps, I can imagine I would get them too on something heavier like Visual Studio.
## Summary of the GitHub issue conversation:


**Key points raised:**

* High CPU usage with the Long Term Memory (LTM) engine in Pieces OS
* The issue affects both Windows and MacOS users
* High CPU usage occurs in Microsoft Edge and other applications like Discord


**Problems identified:**

* The hotfix released did not fully resolve the problem
* The CPU usage issue persists, especially when using Edge with many tabs
* LTM engine seems to be causing the high CPU usage

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* A hotfix was released but it did not completely resolve the issue
* Another update was released to address the issue, but it did not work for everyone 
* Moving the folders to a different drive with Symbolic Links seemed to help for some users
* Turning LTM off and on again temporarily resolves the issue for some users


**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is still being investigated by the Pieces OS team
* A fix is expected to be released next week
* In the meantime, users can try moving the folders to a different drive or turning LTM off and on again


**Additional notes:**

* Some users have reported that the issue has resolved itself after updating Microsoft Edge and WebView2 runtime
* It appears that the issue is related to the WebView2 engine used by both Pieces OS and Edge

related_issues.title: Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
related_issues.text:
Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Current

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

A specific keyboard chain handler that was affected and incapacitated was zvirtualDesktop which has been in use for several years and behaves well with other handlers.

Eventually I was able to kill the Pieces OS instance but as I didn''t know what, if any, other effects there had been I restarted the machine. In logging in the MS new machine set of dialogs started, it evidently believed that this was the first run. I restarted again and so far the machine is working normally.

I uninstalled the Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop before the initial reboot. It's possible there was a dirty Registry on the first restart as it was a warm restart.

I do not believe that this product is suitable for public use without a considerable warning that there may be trouble ahead. As it is I don't think it's a product ready for market given the other points I've observed, (the inability to install it to other than the boot drive, the lack of information or control of where data is stored and so on.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* User (@bpluly) experienced several issues with the Pieces application, including LTM slowing down their PC, PiecesOS failing to launch, and boot-up taking a long time.
* The user uninstalled the product due to the poor first experience.

**Problems identified:**

* Performance issues with LTM causing slow PC.
* PiecesOS not launching properly.
* Slow boot-up times.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Pieces Support offered to help troubleshoot the issues by providing links to related issues, helpful resources, and suggesting a follow-up within 24 hrs.
* Mark-at-pieces (@mark-at-pieces) from the Pieces team reached out personally and offered a call to discuss the user's experience and debug the issues.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The user has uninstalled the product.
* Mark-at-pieces has offered a call to discuss the issues and potentially resolve them.
* It is unclear whether the user will take the team up on their offer.

**Overall:**

The user encountered several technical issues with the Pieces application. While the support team offered assistance, the user ultimately uninstalled the product. Mark-at-pieces has reached out to offer further help and potentially salvage the situation.

related_issues.text:
Pieces desktop application is very slow/laggy, not generating any response in copilot chat.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.0.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces desktop application is working very much slow after latest update, takes very much time to give any response. Even after doing a hard reset active runtime, it just do not work. 
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation:

**Key points raised:**

* Copilot performance was slower than before.
* After hard-resetting the active runtime, the copilot would hang indefinitely.
* Even after updates, some users experienced lag and high CPU usage.

**Problems identified:**

* A bug in the copilot experience related to hard-resetting the active runtime.
* Performance issues after the latest updates.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* A fix for the hard-reset issue was implemented and released in a patch.
* Pieces OS 10.0.2 and Pieces Desktop 3.0.2 were released with fixes for performance issues.
* Version 3.1.0 of the Desktop app was released with further performance improvements.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The hard-reset issue has been fixed.
* Performance improvements have been made, but some users may still experience lag.
* The development team is investigating the remaining performance issues.

**Additional notes:**

* The issue seems to be more prevalent on Windows 11.
* The development team is available for further troubleshooting via chat.

common_issues.title: Copilot Performance Issues
common_issues.description: Users report slow performance, unresponsiveness, and inaccurate responses from Copilot. This occurs across different OS versions and involves various LLM models. Proposed solutions include restarting PiecesOS, updating to the latest version, and switching to alternative LLM models like Gemini 2.0 Flash. While some fixes have been implemented, performance issues persist for some users.

related_issues.text:
Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
### Checked for Existing Issues?

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**The Bug**
The chat assistant will respond claiming that it's working on a solution and will get back to you at a later date. 

**Expected Behaviour**
Get an actionable response with some suggested action/code.

**Details**
Most recent example of this kind of response ("_" is not part of the response just a redaction):

> "I'll carefully examine the data flow related to _, _, _, _, and _  to see if any inconsistencies could lead to bugs. Please give me a few minutes to review the code thoroughly with this specific focus in mind. I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible."

This has happened in three different conversations. I first noticed the behaviour this month, so not before updates preceding March. I promise I'm not trying to be lazy on this one, it's difficult to offer reproduction steps.

I use Claude 3.5 more than any option regularly.

The last conversation where this happened:

- I loaded 15 files into the context menu
- I sent 22 requests (and received 22 responses where it happened on the 22nd response)

I'll update this issue if there's anything I can do to make the reproduction more narrow.
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Issue Title:** Copilot not loading files into context after 11 requests

**Key Points:**

* Sean reported a bug where the copilot failed to load files into the context after 11 requests and 11 responses.
* Sean was unable to reproduce the bug on demand.
* Mark suggested switching to Gemini 2.0 Flash to see if it resolved the issue.
* Sean confirmed that the bug did not occur with Flash.
* Mark closed the issue, assuming it would be fixed in the next release (11.2.3).

**Problems Identified:**

* Copilot was not loading files into the context, leading to inaccurate responses.
* The bug was difficult to reproduce.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Switching to Gemini 2.0 Flash.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue was closed, assuming it would be fixed in the next release.
* Sean was advised to reach out again if the problem persisted.

**Additional Notes:**

* The related issue #652 may be relevant to this problem.
* The user can refer to the provided resources for further assistance.

When using LTM-2 to test the secret message example:
https://pieces.app/magic-moments/ltm

I got a strange response from the LLM:
Claude 3.5:
First Try:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1962a3e4-8b02-4d3f-bc8c-4bdd72c80aa6)
2. try: (waited longer on the website)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cd71c5c1-d5d5-4449-acd5-e070fb244fa9)

Gemini 2.0 Flash did fail completely:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/50735f7a-28a1-4563-b490-e10c271eca23)
## GitHub Issue Summary: "PiecesOS enters basic mode due to device constraints"

**Key Points:**

* Some users (including M3 Mac users) were experiencing an issue where PiecesOS would enter "basic mode" due to "device constraints". This caused the Workstream Activity view to be inaccessible and the LTM engine to not show updates.
* This issue was reported by multiple users including @hra42, @joelash, and @bartonfriedland.
* The issue seems to be related to a bug in PiecesOS that incorrectly identified certain devices as not supporting vector search.

**Proposed/Implemented Solutions:**

* Restarting PiecesOS was a temporary fix for the issue. 
* A fix for the bug was implemented in a later version of PiecesOS. 
* The developers also improved the Workstream Activity view to be accessible even when the window is resized to half its size.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue should be resolved with the updated version of PiecesOS.
* The Workstream Activity view should now be accessible regardless of the window size.

**Additional Notes:**

* The "unknown origin" application version 1.0.10 is likely a leftover from a previous installation of PiecesOS and can be safely ignored.

common_issues.description: Users report various issues related to downloading, installing, and running LLMs within Pieces OS. related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Problem:**

* Pieces-OS is unable to download and use the Ollama LLM due to missing `curl` program in the sandboxed environment of the snap installation.

**Key Points Raised:**

* User `brian-at-pieces` identified the issue as missing `curl`.
* User `ekuznetsov139` confirmed having `curl` but explained the sandbox limitations of the snap installation.
* Users `ekuznetsov139`, `cwoolfo1`, and `umeshwayakole27` expressed the need for a fix.
* User `senyor` encountered an error mentioning `curl` during Ollama installation.

**Proposed/Implemented Solutions:**

* User `brian-at-pieces` suggested installing `curl` manually. (Not applicable due to sandbox)
* Pieces team acknowledged the problem and is working on a patch to enable Ollama usage from within the sandbox.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The patch is in progress but not yet released. 
* Users are waiting for a fix to download and utilize local LLM models.
* User data security concerns are raised regarding cloud LLMs.

**Next Steps:**

* Monitor the issue for updates on the fix progress. 
* Consider alternative solutions for local LLM model usage in the meantime (if available).

related_issues.title: Bug: unable to cancel the download of an LLLM
related_issues.text:
Bug: unable to cancel the download of an LLLM
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6e730898-a168-4571-ab0d-6331c4d389a4)

i want stop but its not working 

## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key points raised:**

* Download button stuck, doesn't stop download process on large models like Mistral 8, 7B.
* Issue persists regardless of internet connection, indicating problem lies with the client itself.
* Some users have encountered this issue across different operating systems (Windows and macOS).

**Problems identified:**

* Download process cannot be stopped, leading to stalled downloads and resource wastage.
* Potential for increased disk space usage due to incomplete downloads.
* Unresponsiveness of the stop button during download, leading to multiple clicks and stuck initialization phase.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* **Temporary fix:** Delete all files from `C:/Users/[YOUR-USERNAME]/Documents/com.pieces.os/** and do a fresh install of the Pieces OS and desktop app.
* **Others tried but didn't work:** Reinstalling without deleting data, reinstalling OpenAI/Ollama, disconnecting from the internet, restarting the machine.

**Current status/outcome:**

* There is no permanent solution found yet. The issue seems to be related to the client-side infrastructure, which is undergoing replacement.
* Replacement of the Local Large Language Model stack is expected to be completed in the next 2-3 weeks, which might potentially resolve the issue.
* Users are encouraged to contact @mark-at-pieces to join real-time discussions regarding the issue through their provided calendar link.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS unable to enable LTM
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS unable to enable LTM
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When attempting to enable the LTM engine, either in the Pieces desktop app by clicking "Allow" for "Periodic Application Indexing" or in the Pieces OS directly, clicking "Enable Long Term Memory Engine", nothing happens. Even after multiple Pieces OS restarts and a clean install. 

Tailed the local log while doing both operations, only clicking "Enable Long Term Memory Engine" resulted in logs:
```
[D]  Sentry Error Event: 351d4b13dbae46589cabd593569f9049
```

[piecesOS-03162025log.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19275571/piecesOS-03162025log.txt)
Also confirmed permissions were granted appropriately:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2fa7002e-0c18-46fe-abaf-288350a90b1b)

Loop in Detail:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c964a15d-2307-4d83-a9f8-0d82d7b608b8

I can reproduce quickly and easily if you need more details/fresh logs!
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Title:** LTM Engine not activating

**Key Points:**

* User (@kwburgess) reported issues activating the LTM Engine.
* Pieces support bot triaged the issue and suggested helpful resources.
* @mark-at-pieces identified the issue as a permissioning problem on the user's machine.
* The required permissions were for screen recording, system recording, and accessibility.

**Problems Identified:**

* LTM Engine wouldn't activate.
* Necessary permissions weren't clearly listed.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @mark-at-pieces provided instructions to check and grant required permissions.
* Offered real-time resolution via calendar link.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User confirmed having granted necessary permissions.
* Issue appears to be resolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user had previously granted all permissions shown in Pieces' interface, highlighting a potential UI issue in accurately displaying required permissions.

recommendations: **Address High-Impact Issues:** Prioritize resolving the "Pieces OS LTM High CPU Usage" and "Copilot Performance Issues" as they are the most frequent and impactful problems.
**Improve LLM Download/Installation:** Investigate and fix the root causes behind LLM download/installation failures and inability to cancel downloads to ensure a smoother user experience.

**Enhance Pieces OS and Desktop App Stability:** Address the reported functionality issues, including LTM activation failures, inaccurate LLM responses, and connection problems, to improve overall application stability.

**Review Personal Domain and Backup Functionality:** Investigate and resolve issues related to personal domain conflicts, outdated backups, and connection problems to ensure seamless backup and restore processes.
**Improve Communication on Permissions:** Provide clearer guidance on required permissions during installation and in the app's settings to avoid confusion and potential errors.

**Monitor Specific Error Messages:** Investigate recurring error messages like "Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect" and "GetIt: Object/factory with type gAb is not registered" to identify and address underlying technical issues.
**Proactive Support and User Education:** Offer proactive support resources, FAQs, and tutorials to address common issues and empower users to troubleshoot problems independently.
**Gather User Feedback:** Implement a system for collecting user feedback on support experiences to identify areas for improvement and enhance support operations continually.
